forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West wind 14 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 45. Northwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds under a quilt of clouds, dappled with the tentative embrace of sunlight peeking through. Rain showers are likely to taper off just before four, leaving a mix of dampness and refreshing breezes in their wake. With temperatures hovering around the mid-fifties and a brisk west wind brushing through, it’s a day best suited for layering—a cozy sweater beneath a light water-repellent jacket would serve you well, providing warmth without sacrificing comfort.

As you navigate the city streets, expect an air of quiet contemplation; the chill in the air invites a moment of reflection over a warm cup at a local café. Perhaps a gentle stroll along the waterfront will reveal distant views of the Golden Gate, wrapped in a soft haze—a reminder of the ever-changing character of this iconic city. Outdoor art installations or a leisurely jaunt through the Presidio could also be delightful choices, each offering a unique perspective of the San Francisco landscape, whispering tales of the maritime layer retreating just beyond the horizon. The time is ripe for simple pleasures, whether alone or shared with a companion, as the evening beckons with promises of tranquility and respite.
